compounddef.innerclass: checkpoint::SerializeVirtualTypeIfNeeded< T, SerializerT, typename std::enable_if_t< dispatch::vrt::VirtualSerializeTraits< T >::has_not_virtual_serialize >>
checkpoint::ReconstructAsVirtualIfNeeded< T, SerializerT, typename std::enable_if_t< dispatch::vrt::VirtualSerializeTraits< T >::has_virtual_serialize >>
checkpoint::SerializeVirtualTypeIfNeeded< T, SerializerT, typename std::enable_if_t< dispatch::vrt::VirtualSerializeTraits< T >::has_virtual_serialize >>

checkpoint::ReconstructAsVirtualIfNeeded< T, SerializerT, typename std::enable_if_t< dispatch::vrt::VirtualSerializeTraits< T >::has_not_virtual_serialize and not std::is_same< SerializerT, checkpoint::Footprinter >::value >>

checkpoint::ReconstructAsVirtualIfNeeded< T, SerializerT, typename std::enable_if_t< dispatch::vrt::VirtualSerializeTraits< T >::has_not_virtual_serialize and std::is_same< SerializerT, checkpoint::Footprinter >::value >>

briefdescription.para: Callback for user to allocate bytes during serialization.

memberdef.definition: using checkpoint::isNonIntReconstructibleType = typedef std::enable_if_t< SerializableTraits<T, void>::is_nonintrusive_reconstructible>
memberdef.name: isNonIntReconstructibleType

memberdef.definition: using checkpoint::isNotReconstructibleType = typedef std::enable_if_t<not SerializableTraits<T, void>::is_reconstructible>
memberdef.name: isNotReconstructibleType

memberdef.definition: using checkpoint::isNotTaggedConstructibleType = typedef std::enable_if_t<not SerializableTraits<T, void>::is_tagged_constructible>
memberdef.name: isNotTaggedConstructibleType

memberdef.definition: using checkpoint::isNotConstructible = typedef std::enable_if_t<not SerializableTraits<T, void>::is_constructible>
memberdef.name: isNotConstructible

briefdescription.para: Serialize T into a byte buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Serializes an object recursively by invoking the serialize functions/methods recursively.

parameterdescription.para: the T to serialize

(optional) callback to supply buffer for to allow user allocation of the produced byte buffer. The callback will be passed the number of bytes required and return a char* to a buffer of at least that many bytes.

simplesect.para: a std::unique_ptr to a SerializedInfo containing the buffer with serialized data and the size of the buffer

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a byte buffer and corresponding size.

detaileddescription.para: De-serializes an object recursively by first invoking the reconstruction strategy and then serialize functions/methods recursively to rebuild the state of the object as serialized. During reconstruction, based on trait detection, T will either be default constructed on user_buf (or a system allocated buffer) or reconstructed based on a user-defined reconstruct method. If user_buf is not passed, the returned object point must be deallocated with delete

parameterdescription.para: the buffer containing the bytes to reify T

(optional) buffer containing bytes allocated with sufficient size for T. If this buffer != null, the caller is responsible for deallocating the buffer. If it is not passed, the system will allocate a buffer that must be de-allocated with delete

simplesect.para: a pointer to the newly reified T based on bytes in buf

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a byte buffer and corresponding size.

detaileddescription.para: De-serializes an object recursively by first invoking the reconstruction strategy and then serialize functions/methods recursively to rebuild the state of the object as serialized. During reconstruction, based on trait detection, T will either be default constructed or reconstructed based on a user-defined reconstruct method.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer containing the bytes to reify T

simplesect.para: a unique pointer to the newly reified T based on bytes in buf

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a byte buffer and corresponding size in-place on the user-provided t.

detaileddescription.para: Note: the other form of deserialize will either reconstruct to default construct T in-place. This overload will not allocate or construct T

parameterdescription.para: the buffer containing the bytes to reify T
a valid pointer to a T that has been user-allocated and constructed

briefdescription.para: Convenience function for de-serializing and reify T directly from in the return value from serialize.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer and size combo returned from serialize

simplesect.para: a unique pointer to T that must be deallocated

briefdescription.para: Get the number of bytes that target requires for serialization.

parameterdescription.para: reference to T to size

simplesect.para: number of bytes for the target

detaileddescription.para: Calculates memory footprint for both serializable and non-serializable objects. Uses serialize functions/methods recursively when they are available. For non-serializable objects, simplified footprinting is performed by just applying 'sizeof' operator (note: this means that complex objects will not be traversed).

parameterdescription.para: reference to T to measure footprint
add an arbitrary size_offset to the footprint

briefdescription.para: Serialize T to file with filename file.

detaileddescription.para: Byte-serializes T to file, truncating file if it already exists. If any error occurs while opening/closing/mapping the file, std::runtime_error will be thrown with an appropriate error message containing the corresponding errno.

parameterdescription.para: the T to serialize
name of the file to create

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a file.

detaileddescription.para: De-serializes an object recursively by first invoking the reconstruction strategy and then serialize functions/methods recursively to rebuild the state of the object as serialized. During reconstruction, based on trait detection, T will either be default constructed or reconstructed based on a user-defined reconstruct method.

parameterdescription.para: the filename to read with bytes for T

simplesect.para: unique pointer to the new object T

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a file in place on an existing pointer to T.

detaileddescription.para: De-serializes an object recursively by invoking the serialize functions/methods recursively to rebuild the state of the object as serialized.

parameterdescription.para: the filename to read with bytes for T
a valid, constructed T to deserialize into

detaileddescription.para: Byte-serializes T to stream. Handling of any errors during writing to the stream will be handled by the stream itself, e.g. any exceptions or status bits to check will depend on stream type.

parameterdescription.para: the T to serialize
to serialize into, with tellp and write functions.

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a stream.

detaileddescription.para: De-serializes an object recursively by first invoking the reconstruction strategy and then serialize functions/methods recursively to rebuild the state of the object as serialized. During reconstruction, based on trait detection, T will either be default constructed or reconstructed based on a user-defined reconstruct method.

parameterdescription.para: the stream to read with bytes for T, with tellg and read functions

simplesect.para: unique pointer to the new object T

briefdescription.para: De-serialize and reify T from a stream in place on an existing pointer to T.

detaileddescription.para: De-serializes an object recursively by invoking the serialize functions/methods recursively to rebuild the state of the object as serialized.

parameterdescription.para: the stream to read with bytes for T, with tellg and read functions
a valid, constructed T to deserialize into

detaileddescription.para: Only footprinting mode is supported at the moment.

parameterdescription.para: serializer to use
function to serialize

memberdef.name: deserializeEmplaceElems

detaileddescription.para: Only footprinting mode is supported at the moment. Counts the pointer size and follows it (note that it doesn't work correctly for C-style arrays!).

parameterdescription.para: serializer to use
pointer to serialize

detaileddescription.para: Note: do not follow void pointer.
Resizes a string to its actual size and serializes it. Note: footprinting mode does not detect small string optimization, so a limited overcount is possible.

parameterdescription.para: serializer to use
string to serialize

memberdef.type: std::enable_if_t< not std::is_same< SerializerT, checkpoint::Footprinter >::value, void >
memberdef.definition: std::enable_if_t< not std::is_same<SerializerT, checkpoint::Footprinter>::value, void> checkpoint::serialize
memberdef.name: serialize

memberdef.type: std::enable_if_t< not std::is_same< SerializerT, checkpoint::Footprinter >::value, void >
memberdef.definition: std::enable_if_t< not std::is_same<SerializerT, checkpoint::Footprinter>::value, void> checkpoint::serialize
memberdef.name: serialize

briefdescription.para: Allocate and construct memory for a pointer with type T.

detaileddescription.para: This function automatically handles allocating and constructing the right type for virtually serialized pointers or non-virtual static allocation and construction.
An example of how to use this to properly serialize a std::shared_ptr<T>:
template <typename t>=""> struct X { std::shared_ptr<T> a;

template <typename serializert>=""> void serialize(SerializerT& s) { T* raw = elm.get(); checkpoint::reconstructPointedToObjectIfNeeded(s, raw); if (s.isUnpacking()) { a = std::shared_ptr<T>(raw); } s | *a; } };

parameterdescription.para: the serializer
a reference to a pointer to the target object
